Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat (such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot) and a water habitat (such as a pond, stream, or lake).

The student can include different types of living things found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants in a land habitat, and fish, clams, or other water creatures in a water habitat.
The student can illustrate and label at least two different animals that might live in each habitat (e.g., squirrels and lizards in a land habitat, or fish and frogs in a water habitat).
The student can show the diversity of plant life by drawing different types of plants found in each habitat.
The student can identify patterns by comparing and labeling similar and different living things in both types of habitats.
